sorcer.service

Class Task

  • java.lang.Object
    • sorcer.service.ServiceExertion
      • sorcer.service.Task
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Evaluation<Object>, Exec, Exertion, Identifiable, Invocation<Object>, Mappable, Revaluation, Service
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AltExertion, AntTask, EvaluationTask, LoopExertion, ObjectTask, OptExertion

    public class Task
extends ServiceExertion
    A Task is an elementary service-oriented message Exertion (with its own service Context and a collection of service Signatures. Signatures of four Signature.Types can be associated with each task: SERVICE, PREPROCESS, POSTROCESS, and APPEND. However, only a single PROCESS signature can be associated with a task but multiple preprocessing, postprocessing, and context appending methods can be added.
    Author:
    Mike Sobolewski
    See Also:
    Exertion, Job, Serialized Form

      • isJob

        public boolean isJob()
        Returns true if this exertion requires execution by a Jobber, otherwise false if this exertion requires its execution by a Tasker. Note that control follow exertion can be processed by either a Tasker or a Jobber.
        Specified by:
        isJob in interface Exertion
        Overrides:
        isJob in class ServiceExertion
        Returns:
        true if this exertion requires execution by a Jobber.
